meta.title: Apollo.io Overview 2026: Features, Pricing, and G2 Ratings | Sales AI Guide
meta.description: Apollo.io product profile with G2 ratings, pricing tiers, key features, and competitor comparison table. Data aggregated from G2 and vendor documentation.

meta.twitterTitle: Apollo.io Overview 2026: Features, Pricing, and G2 Ratings | Sales AI Guide
meta.twitterDescription: Apollo.io product profile with G2 ratings, pricing breakdown, key features, and competitor comparison. Data from public sources.

acceptedAnswer.text: Apollo claims 275M+ contacts with regular updates. Data accuracy is generally strong for North American companies, but users report degraded quality for niche verticals, international markets, and smaller companies. Expect 85-90% accuracy for mainstream B2B contacts.

mainEntity.name: What are the free tier limits?

acceptedAnswer.text: Apollo's free tier includes 150 email credits per month, 5 mobile credits, basic sequences (2 active), and limited filters. It's enough to test the platform but not sufficient for production prospecting.

mainEntity.name: How does Apollo compare to ZoomInfo?

acceptedAnswer.text: Apollo is significantly cheaper ($49/user/mo annual or $59/user/mo monthly vs $15K+/year) and includes built-in email sequences and a CRM. ZoomInfo offers better data quality and enterprise features (intent data, org charts) but at 10-30x the price. Apollo is the go-to for SMB and mid-market; ZoomInfo dominates enterprise.

hero.h1: Apollo.io: All-in-One Sales Intelligence & Engagement Platform

org.verdict: Good all-in-one, data gaps at scale

quickSummary.whatItDoes: All-in-one sales intelligence and engagement platform with 275M+ B2B contacts, email sequences, dialer, and CRM.
quickSummary.bestFor: SDRs and AEs who need prospecting + outreach in one tool without paying enterprise prices.
quickSummary.pricing: Free tier available. Basic $49/user/mo (annual) or $59/user/mo (monthly). Professional $79/user/mo (annual) or $99/user/mo (monthly). Organization $119/user/mo (annual) or $149/user/mo (monthly, min 3 users).

paragraphs: Apollo.io is an all-in-one sales intelligence and engagement platform with 275M+ B2B contacts, email sequencing, a built-in dialer, and CRM — bundled at $49/user/mo (annual) or $59/user/mo (monthly), making it the default choice for startups and mid-market teams wanting prospecting + outreach in one tool.
whatIs.noteHtml: Note: Based on vendor docs and G2 reviews, not firsthand testing. See Apollo.io on G2.

features.title: 275M+ Contact Database
features.description: B2B database with email, phone, title, and company data.

features.title: Email Sequences with A/B Testing
features.description: Multi-step sequences with auto follow-ups and A/B testing.

features.title: Built-in Dialer
features.description: Click-to-call with recording, voicemail drops, and local presence.

features.title: Chrome Extension for LinkedIn
features.description: Pull contact data from LinkedIn profiles into sequences.

features.title: CRM with Pipeline Management
features.description: Deal tracking with pipeline stages and basic forecasting.

features.title: Intent Data Signals
features.description: Identify accounts actively researching relevant topics.

verdict.bestFor: SDRs and AEs at startups or mid-market companies who need prospecting, email sequences, and a basic CRM in one affordable platform.
verdict.avoidIf: You need enterprise-grade data quality for niche markets, or you already have a mature Outreach/Salesloft + ZoomInfo stack.
verdict.bottomLine: Apollo is the best value all-in-one sales tool on the market — 80% of ZoomInfo's data at 5% of the price, plus built-in engagement. The tradeoff is data accuracy at the margins and enterprise features.

org.explain: Good all-in-one value for mid-market teams, but enterprise compliance and advanced integrations have gaps.

individual.explain: Free tier, Chrome extension, and built-in sequences make it the easiest all-in-one for individual reps.

decisionSnapshot.intro: Scores from 0–10 based on our scoring methodology.

evidenceSignals.confidenceNote: Based on multi-platform review synthesis, broad practitioner discussion, Chrome extension demos verified, and current vendor documentation. Strong signal across 9,344+ public reviews.

evidenceGrid.text: Review sentiment: Praise: all-in-one value for prospecting + outreach. Complaint: data accuracy varies by region
Community workflows: Prospecting + sequencing in one platform, Chrome extension workflows
Demo-verified: Contact search, sequence builder, enrichment engine
Docs verified: Pricing tiers, 275M+ contact database, API documentation

strengthThemes: All-in-one value across prospecting + outreach + enrichment
limitationThemes: Data accuracy varies significantly by region
Email deliverability weaker than dedicated tools
evidenceSignals.disagreeNote: ⚠️ Where sources disagree: Vendor claims 275M+ contacts; community reports accuracy drops outside US/UK. G2 praises breadth; practitioners note depth gaps on enrichment.

userVoiceThemes.heading: All-in-one platform eliminates tool sprawl
userVoiceThemes.synthesis: Teams consistently praise Apollo for combining prospecting, enrichment, and sequencing in one login. The ability to find a lead, enrich it, and drop it into a sequence without switching tools is cited as the primary productivity gain, especially for startups that would otherwise need 3-4 separate subscriptions.
userVoiceThemes.quote: "We replaced Outreach, ZoomInfo, and a standalone dialer with Apollo and cut our monthly tooling spend by 60%. One login for everything our SDR team needs."
userVoiceThemes.quoteCite: Synthesized from G2 and community review themes

userVoiceThemes.heading: Data accuracy concerns with 15-20% bounce rates
userVoiceThemes.synthesis: The most consistent criticism across all platforms is email data accuracy. Users report bounce rates of 15-20% on exported lists, particularly for niche verticals, international markets, and smaller companies. Teams targeting non-tech sectors or outside North America experience the sharpest accuracy drop-off.
userVoiceThemes.quote: "We exported 2,000 contacts targeting European manufacturing and hit a 22% bounce rate. For US tech companies the data is solid, but niche international lists need a verification layer on top."
userVoiceThemes.quoteCite: Synthesized from G2 and community review themes

userVoiceThemes.heading: Free tier is the best in the category
userVoiceThemes.synthesis: Apollo's free tier offering 10K leads per month at no cost is universally praised as the most generous in the sales intelligence space. Individual reps and early-stage startups use it as their primary prospecting tool, often for months before upgrading. No competitor matches this level of free access.
userVoiceThemes.quote: "I ran Apollo's free tier for four months as a solo founder before upgrading. No other tool gives you 10K leads a month at zero cost ‚Äî it's how I built my entire initial pipeline."
userVoiceThemes.quoteCite: Synthesized from G2 and community review themes

userVoiceThemes.heading: Chrome extension loved by reps but flagged by IT
userVoiceThemes.synthesis: The Chrome extension for LinkedIn prospecting is one of Apollo's most-used features, allowing reps to pull verified contact data directly from profiles. However, IT and security teams at larger organizations flag the extension's broad permissions as a concern, creating tension between rep productivity and corporate security policies.
userVoiceThemes.quote: "My reps love the Chrome extension for LinkedIn prospecting ‚Äî they pull verified emails in seconds. But our security team flagged the broad permissions and we had to get a formal exception from IT to keep it installed."
userVoiceThemes.quoteCite: Synthesized from G2 and community review themes

userVoiceThemes.heading: All-in-one approach eliminates tool sprawl for SMBs
userVoiceThemes.synthesis: TrustRadius and Software Advice reviewers consistently highlight that Apollo replaces 2-3 separate tools for smaller teams ‚Äî combining prospecting, email sequences, and basic CRM in one platform. Mid-market users report saving $500-1,200/mo by consolidating their stack around Apollo.
userVoiceThemes.quote: "Apollo replaced our ZoomInfo subscription, a separate sequencing tool, and a basic CRM ‚Äî saving us roughly $800 per rep per month. For a 12-person team, that's a game-changer."
userVoiceThemes.quoteCite: Synthesized from G2 and community review themes

pricingBreakdown.tldr: Free tier (150 credits/mo). Basic $49/user/mo (annual) or $59/user/mo (monthly). Professional $79/user/mo (annual) or $99/user/mo (monthly). Organization $119/user/mo (annual) or $149/user/mo (monthly, min 3 users).
gotchas: Free tier (150 credits/mo) is testing only, not production
Annual billing required for best pricing; monthly is 20-30% more
Heavy senders may hit daily email caps

greatAt: 275M+ contact database: More contacts than most competitors at a fraction of the cost
All-in-one eliminates tool sprawl: Data, sequences, dialer, and CRM in one login
Generous free tier: Test the full platform before committing budget
Chrome extension for LinkedIn: Pull verified emails and phones from profiles
Built-in CRM: Pipeline management without a $75/user/mo CRM bill
breaksAtScale: Data accuracy degrades for niche verticals: International and non-tech sectors have lower match rates
Deliverability concerns at high volume: 500+ emails/day without warmup risks spam folders
Basic CRM features: No custom objects, limited reporting
Slow support on lower tiers: Free/Basic users report multi-day response times
Sequences lag Outreach/Salesloft: Fewer channels, simpler branching
whoShouldNotBuy: Enterprise teams needing premium data: ZoomInfo's curated database is worth the premium for mission-critical accuracy
Teams invested in Outreach/Salesloft: Switching costs rarely justify it
Orgs with strict enterprise security requirements: While SOC 2 Type II and ISO 27001 certified, advanced governance features lag enterprise-grade competitors
Large teams (50+ seats): Best-of-breed stacks can be more cost-effective at scale

implementationReality.note: Most reps are searching and sequencing within the first day; CRM integration takes under an hour.

org.heading: Best for Sales Teams & RevOps
items: Mid-market teams wanting prospecting + outreach in one tool
Startups needing database, sequences, and dialer without 3 tools
Teams scaling 5-50 reps with affordable per-seat pricing

individual.heading: Best for Individual Reps
items: SDRs needing a free contact database with email and phone
Reps building prospect lists via Chrome extension
Solo sellers wanting sequences, calling, and data in one login

cards.title: Gong
cards.description: Apollo dialer + Gong call intelligence for coaching.

cards.title: Lavender
cards.description: Lavender scores and coaches email copy written for Apollo-sourced leads.

stackPairings.exampleStack: Apollo (prospect + dial) → Clay (enrich) → Lavender (coach) → Instantly (send) → HubSpot (CRM)
stackPairings.avoidWith: If already using Clay as your primary enrichment layer ‚Äî Apollo's data becomes redundant

faqs.question: Is Apollo's data accurate?
faqs.answer: Generally strong for North American companies, but quality degrades for niche verticals, international markets, and smaller companies. Expect 85-90% accuracy for mainstream B2B contacts.

faqs.question: What are the free tier limits?
faqs.answer: Free tier: 150 email credits/month, 5 mobile credits, 2 active sequences, limited filters. Enough to test but not for production use.

faqs.question: How does Apollo compare to ZoomInfo?
faqs.answer: Apollo is cheaper ($49/user/mo annual or $59/user/mo monthly vs $15K+/year) with built-in sequences and CRM. ZoomInfo has better data and enterprise features at 10-30x the price. Apollo for SMB/mid-market; ZoomInfo for enterprise.
